title: Missoula Training Race
description: The Clinton Training Race is a fun semi-competitive event that has been run since the beginning of time and is also known as the Central Western Montana Spring World Championships. The winner gets lifetime bragging rights and earns the right to put the CWMS-WC stripes on their jersey sleeves
course: The course is a 6.5 mile loop that begins just south of the Clinton over pass about 20 miles east of Missoula, MT. The loop heads west on E. Mullan road and goes under Interstate 90 and intersects with the I-90 frontage road.  A right turn on the frontage road will have the racers headon east back to Clinton. Racers turn right at the Clinton overpass.  The finish line of the race is about 2 miles west of the start line on E. Mullan road.
registration: Registration will be at Missoula Bicycle Works on Saturday morning March 24th beginning at 10:00am.  We have in the past done race site registration for folks arriving from the east, but we encourage all to register at MBW and then join the group of racers to ride out to the course start.  Folks generally leave for Clinton between 10:30 and 11:00am.
notes: The race will be run on open roads so please ride to the right side of the road if vehicles are approaching
directions: The race start and parking is just south of the overpass at the  Clinton, MT exit about 20 miles east of Missoula. If coming from Missoula you can take interstate 90 east. If coming from the east also take I-90 toward Missoula and take the Clinton exit and turn south. Parking is on the dirt road about 150m south of the overpass.

title: Bobcat Classic
course: A 33-mile loop through rural Montana landscape filled with majestic views as riders traverse the rolling hills and narrow river canyons. All riders finish on a grueling 5 km, 1100 ft climb to the top of the Lewis & Clark Caverns.
registration:
Pre-Register: Friday, April 15. 8:30 - 9:30 PM. South Entrance,Strand Union Building (SUB), MSU.

Registration also available on Saturday from 7:45 - 8:30 at the Men’s A start location (L&C Caverns).
directions: From Bozeman: Head west on I-90 for 32 miles. Take exit 274 (Three Forks, US 287). Proceed south on US 287 for 11 miles. Take a right at junction MT 2, continuing for 5 miles until reaching Lewis & Clark Caverns State Park.

title: Bobcat Classic Companion Ride
flyer_url: Bobcat Ride-Race and Champion ride updated 32912.pdf
description: MSU Bobcat Classic Companion Ride - An excellent early season training opportunity. Two classes offered (A/B) to ride the scenic Bobcat Classic loop near Cardwell.
course: A 33-mile loop through rural Montana landscape filled with majestic views as riders traverse the rolling hills and narrow river canyons. All riders finish on a grueling 5 km, 1100 ft climb to the top of the Lewis & Clark Caverns.
directions: From Bozeman: Head west on I-90 for 32 miles. Take exit 274 (Three Forks, US 287). Proceed south on US 287 for 11 miles. Take a right at junction MT 2, continuing for 5 miles until reaching Lewis & Clark Caverns State Park.

address.street: BLM Scratchgravel Hills District, Echo Dr. TH

title: Helenduro pt. 1
description: Enduro Style racing: Time allotments for climbs and final results accumulation of timed sections that include downhill and possibly some climbing.
course: Course to be announced 3 days in advance of event, a surprise for all participants!
registration: Register at the event or evening before or on line at www.usacycling.org
directions: Will gather at The Garage bike shop for shuttles to race start.

title: Herron Hammer
description:
Herron Hammer XC Race - May 20, 2012 -  Flathead Cycling Race Team -
Chief Referee:  Sheli Thomas
notes: Classic XC race with climbs, fun descents, technical section with tight switchbacks and rock feature
directions: From Hwy 93 So:  Take Rocky Cliff rd to Airport Rd., turn left, Airport Rd. turns into Foys Canyon Rd., Foys Canyon Rd. ends at Herron Park.

title: Homestake XC Mountain Bike Race
description: Homestake Lodge sits atop the Continental Divide 3 miles off interstate 90 just east of Butte, MT.   The race is held on USFS land that backs Homestake Lodge\'s cross country ski trails.    The race is part of the MORS state championship series.
course: The course is an 8 mile loop of rolling terrain with a mix of single track and double track/road.
registration: Registration is from 9:30 am to 10:30 am.  The race will start at 11:00 am following a short kids race (parents may run/ride with their kids if needed)
notes:
Promoter reserves the right to combine classes.
One Day licences available $5.
All Pro/Cat1 (Expert) racers must show proof of annual license.
Juniors (M/F) will start with Category 3 racers.  Junior race fee $0.00
Prizes must be collected at Awards Ceremony (no prizes will be mailed)
Awards Ceremony will follow race and completion of results by official.
Official - John Coulthard
directions: Take the Homestake Exit atop Homestake Pass on I-90.  On the south side of the interstate, head up the gravel road (FS road 240) approximately 3 miles to Homestake Lodge.  The road is in good condition and easily passable by 2 wheel drive vehicles.

title: Heneduro Pt. 2
description: Enduro Style Race: time allotments for climbs, accumulation of descents for final placing
course: Courses to be announced 2 days before event.
registration:
Register online www.usacycling.org 
 or at The Garage
directions: Meet at The Garage in Helena for shuttle to race start.

title: Blazing Saddles
description:
On Sunday, 10am, 24 June, we’ll be running a two stage race.  First stage is a 40k ITT (12k and 25k for juniors); any USAC-legal TT or road bike is fine.   
Second stage is a mass-start TT hill climb and any mass start bike is legal; no aerobars.
Points are accrued and overall winners receive awards.
course:
40Km course starts at 200m north of Sunshine Station.  Course runs due north to the turnaround and ends across from the start.  500 feet of altitude loss during the first half (12.5 miles) and then back up on the return.  Same course as last year’s State TT route.  
Afternoon race course starts at 3pm, in the city park, goes through town and past Sunshine Station and taking the first left, Hwy 348, Rock Creek Road.  Stage two is a hill climb up the Rock Creek road, mass-start bikes only.  The first two miles is the neutral start through town.  The pack will stop and then each field will be released with 30 sec spacing.  Each finisher will be timed.  The first 4.25 miles gains 150ft and the last 1.25 miles gains 350ft; steeper than the Georgetown Lake climb.
registration:
Register online at www.usacycling.org.  On-site registration and packet pickup at Sunshine Station, on east side of MT Hwy 1, between Hwy 348 and main turn into Philipsburg. Registration area is in the Southeastern corner, through the back.
One-day licenses can be purchased with pre-registration for $10 and on-site, also for $10.
Scored categories are: Men 1/2; Men 3; Men 4, Men 5; Women 4; Women 3; Women 1/2; Master A; Master B; Juniors 10-14; Juniors 15-16; Juniors 17-18.
notes:
Participation in both stages is not required.  Riders who race in both races race in the second stage for $5.  Riders who race stage one pay $20 and Riders who race stage two only pay $15.  Awards are based on overall points.  Must be present at the awards ceremony to receive prizes/money.
Awards will be at the city park, south end of town, immediately after the riders and judges can get back to the park.
All riders who pre-register for both races will receive a meal and non-alcholic drink coupon from the Club Bar and Grill for one of the lunch specials.
All racers will get a free pair of socks.
Prizes will be for each MBRA category, for each stage, and a prize for the fastest three team member’s cumulative time; regardless of category, age, or sex.  Team members must be wearing a minimum of the team jersey in both races in order to qualify for the team award.  A previous year’s skin suit is acceptable during the 40K TT.
Helmets will be worn at all times while on a bicycle from registartion through the awards ceremony.
Profits from the race go towards supporting the Granite County Search and Rescue.  They provide volunteer assistance, EMT services, and radio communications during the race.
directions: From cities west and Helena area, take the Drummond exit off I-90 and head south 25 miles to Philipsburg.  From cities east, take the Anaconda exit off I-90 and go 38 miles to Philipsburg.

title: Kettle House Weekday MTB Series
description:
Training Series for folks to get ready for the Missoula XC in mid July! Three ways to go: 1 lap/2 laps/3 laps Each lap is 6km in length with approx.
900 vertical per lap. Ice Cream from Big Dipper and other food will be available!
course:
The course is designed and constructed specifically for the Pro XCT event in mid July, and will reflect the contemporary World Cup course
template. Steep, technical climbs and descents will alternate between single track, double track, and infrequent dirt road sections. Frequent and
sudden rhythm changes will challenge racers, but several sequences of fast and fun sections will be included as well. The course features over 900
feet (275 m) of relief per lap; while it is not at extremely high altitude, multiple long, steep climbs per lap will test racers’ fitness limits. Course
maps and elevation profiles can be found on the race website.
registration:
Register on-line or on site. Promoter strongly recommends registering on-line - go to; https://www.usacycling.org/myusac/index.php?pagename=registration&eventid=2418&year=2012
All riders must have a current USA Cycling license or a one day
permit which is NOT reflected in the registration fee.
notes:
All participants will be started at the time in waves. Beginning riders will go 1 lap, more advanced 2 laps, advanced rides will go 3 laps. Pick your
poison, but beware sandbaggers will be \"outed\"!! Build your skills and come have fun!
directions:
Located at Marshall Mountain 7 miles from downtown Missoula. From the Van Buren I90 exit take East Broadway towards East Missoula. East
Broadway is also called Highway 200. Follow East Broadway/Hwy 200 for roughly 3.6 miles. Turn left onto Marshall Canyon Road (There will be a
Marshall Resort Sign). Take Marshall Canyon Road for 2.7 miles. Parking is in the lot past the gate.

title: Hellroaring Moutain Bike Stage Race
description: 3 day cross county mountain bike stage race in Whitefish, Montana.
course:
August 3rd -Individual Time Trial: Beaver Trail Loop on the Whitefish Trail - 12 miles.
August 4th - XC Race: Reid Divide-Bill Creek - 34 miles
August 5th - XC Race: Whitefish Mountain Resort - 22 miles

title: Beartooth Blitz
description: The Beartooth Blitz.  What started as a small community ride up the Beartooth Pass, has grown to one of Montana\'s most epic races.  The all new reformed Beartooth Ride, is now a two day stage sure to test your legs.  With a 40 mile Road Race on Saturday and a 23 mile hill climb on Sunday this is a race that you don\'t want to miss.
course:
August 4th - The new leg of the race is a 40 mile road bike race through the Stillwater Valley.  This day\'s activities start at Montana Jack\'s in Dean, Montana.  Racers head east on a mostly downhill course to Fishtail, Montana.  Once in Fishtail its back up to Dean and past the starting line.  After a short CAT 5 Climb racers rocket down into Nye, Montana and into the Stillwater Drainage.  At mile marker 30 its back towards Dean with the final climb of the day. This 4 mile CAT 3 climb will either be a great place to drop the pack, or feel the lead in the legs.

August 5th - The climb that started it all.  Recently named one of the 5 top Bike Climbs in the Nation, the Beartooth Pass is a once in a life time kind of a ride.  This day\'s activities will start at Rock Creek Resort, located 6 miles south of Red Lodge, Montana.  Racers will leave in 30 second intervals in a Time Trial Format.  This CAT 1 climb rises up over 4700 feet during its span of 23 miles.  So you better enjoy the 66 feet of descending that you get at the starting line.  The race ends at the International Race Camp located on the East Summit of the Beartooth Pass.
registration: Online registration available online at beartoothrun.com.  Cost for race is $35 per day or $60 for the weekend.    All registration ends on July 31st 2012.  No late or day of registration.  Packet pickup available the day before each race and at the starting line of each race.
notes: Racers have the option of racing on either saturday or sunday.  But are encouraged to come for the full weekend.  Cost for race is $35 per day or $60 for the weekend.
directions: Saturday\'s race start is in Dean Montana located west of Red Lodge on Nye Road.  Sunday\'s race start is at the Rock Creek Resort, located 6 miles south of Red Lodge on Highway 212.  More info at beartoothrun.com
